NAEB Region #1 Meeting
Carnegie International Center
September 20-21, 1958
Programs
SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 20, 1958
9s00-11:30 A.M.—FIRST SESSION: 2nd floor Lounge — 3U5 East h6th st.
Themes Regional Networks and Cooperative Programming
1. Recent Importart Events In Region I Educational Broadcasting-
collected and presented by Ralph Steetle, Executive Director,
Joint Council on Educational Television.
2. Report from Headquarters—Harry J. Skornia, Executive Dir., NAEB.
3* A Live Regional PM Network—
Seymour N. Siegel, Dir. of Radio Communications, New York City.
4. A Potential Live Network for Television—
Hartford N. Gunn, Jr., General Manager, WGBH-FM and WGEH-TV,
Boston, Massachusetts
Moderator: E.A. Hungerford, Jr., Dir. of Operations (on leave).
Metropolitan Educatinal Television Association, Inc.
12:00 noon-1:30 P.M. —Informal lunch at the Beekman Tower or your
choice. No program at lunch.
2:00-lr.3Q P.M.—SECOND SESSION: 2nd floor Lounge - 3*4-5 East U6th st.
Theme: The Superintendents1 Viewpoints on In-School TV
Five prominent Superintendents will give short statements about
In-School Television in their cities and report significant results,
after which there wil^be open discussion.
Dr. William M. Brish—Hagerstown, Md*
Dr. Harold B. Gores—ITewton. Mass
Dr. Calvin E. Gross—Pittsburgh, Pa.
Dr. John J. Theobald—New York City
Dr. Allen H. Wetter-Philaddlphia, Pa.
Moderator—Dr. Alan Willard Brown, President, Metropolitan
Educational Television Association, Inc.
